CMS_Deep_Learning.preprocessing¶

preprocessing¶

CMS_Deep_Learning.preprocessing.preprocessing.gen_from_data(lst, batch_size, data_keys=[‘Particles’, ‘Labels’], verbose=1)[source]¶

Gets a generator that generates data of batch_size from a list of DataProcedures. Optionally uses threading to apply getData in parellel, although this may be obsolete with the proper fit_generator settings

Parameters:
  • lst (str or list) – a list of .h5 filepaths and/or DataProcedures or a directory path
  • batch_size (int) – The number of samples to grab at each call to next()
  • data_keys (list of str) – The keys to draw from in the .h5 files. (order matters)
  • verbose (int) – whether or not to print out info to the user.
Returns:

a generator that runs through the given data
CMS_Deep_Learning.preprocessing.preprocessing.nb_samples_from_h5(file_path)[source]¶

Get the number of samples contained in any .h5 file; numpy or pandas.

Parameters:file_path – The file_path
Returns:the number of samples
CMS_Deep_Learning.preprocessing.preprocessing.get_sizes_meta_dict(directory, verbose=0)[source]¶

Returns a dictionary of the number of sample points contained in each .h5 file in a directory

Parameters:directory – The directory where the .h5 files are
Returns:the sizes dictionary
CMS_Deep_Learning.preprocessing.preprocessing.size_from_meta(filename, sizesDict=None, verbose=0)[source]¶

Quickly resolves the number of entries in a file from metadata, making sure to update the metadata if necessary

Parameters:
  • filename – The path the the file.
  • sizesDict – (optional) the sizes dictionary gotten from get_sizes_meta_dict, if not passed will find it anyway.
Returns:

The number of samples in the file

pandas_to_numpy¶

CMS_Deep_Learning.preprocessing.pandas_to_numpy.pandas_to_numpy(data_dirs, start, samples_per_class, observ_types={‘Particles’: [‘Energy’, ‘Px’, ‘Py’, ‘Pz’, ‘Pt’, ‘Eta’, ‘Phi’, ‘Charge’, ‘ChPFIso’, ‘GammaPFIso’, ‘NeuPFIso’, ‘isChHad’, ‘isEle’, ‘isGamma’, ‘isMu’, ‘isNeuHad’, ‘vtxX’, ‘vtxY’, ‘vtxZ’], ‘HLF’: [‘HT’, ‘MET’, ‘MT’, ‘PhiMET’, ‘bJets’, ‘nJets’]}, sort_columns=None, sort_ascending=True, verbose=1)[source]¶

Builds a trainable (particle level) sorted and (event level) shuffled numpy array from directories of pandas .h5 files.

Parameters:
  • data_dirs – A list of pandas directories containing pandas .h5 files, tuples of (‘label’,’dir’), or dictionary with .values() equal to such a list. The order indicates which files correspond to which output (i.e. the first directory corresponds to [1,0,…,0] and the second to [0,1,…,0], etc.). For dictionaries the order defaults to the alphabetical order of the directory names.
  • start – Where to start reading (as if all of the files in a given directory are part of one long list)
  • samples_per_class – The number of samples to read for each label. Every directory must have enough data starting from ‘start’.
  • observ_types – The column headers for the data to be read from the panadas table. Also indicated the order of the columns.
  • sort_columns – The columns to sort by, or special quantities including [MaxLepDeltaPhi, MaxLepDeltaEta,MaxLepDeltaR,MaxLepKt,MaxLepAntiKt]
  • sort_ascending – If True sort in ascending order, false decending
Returns:

(X_train, Y_train, HFL_train)
CMS_Deep_Learning.preprocessing.pandas_to_numpy.make_datasets(sources, output_dir, num_samples, size=1000, num_processes=1, sort_on=None, sort_ascending=False, v_split=0.0, force=False)[source]¶

Creates a data set in the output_dir folder with /train and /val subdirectories

Parameters:
  • sources (list of str) – a list of source directories of pandas .h5 files. Order matters; the first source corresponds to [1,0,..,0], the second to [0,1,..,0],etc.
  • output_dir (str) – the directory to output to
  • num_samples (int) – the number of samples to take for each class
  • size (int or str) – the number of samples to put in each file, or ‘<int>MB’ (i.e ‘100MB’) corresponding to the target filesize
  • num_processes (int) – The number of processes to use concurrently to build the dataset
  • sort_on (str) – The column or special value [MaxLepDeltaPhi,MaxLepDeltaEta,MaxLepDeltaR,MaxLepKt,MaxLepAntiKt] to sort on
  • sort_ascending (bool) – whether to sort ascending or descending
  • v_split (float or int) – the proportion of the total data to use for validation, or the total number of events to use (the rest goes to training)
CMS_Deep_Learning.preprocessing.pandas_to_numpy.get_from_pandas(f, file_start_read, samples_to_read, file_total_events=-1, observ_types={‘Particles’: [‘Energy’, ‘Px’, ‘Py’, ‘Pz’, ‘Pt’, ‘Eta’, ‘Phi’, ‘Charge’, ‘ChPFIso’, ‘GammaPFIso’, ‘NeuPFIso’, ‘isChHad’, ‘isEle’, ‘isGamma’, ‘isMu’, ‘isNeuHad’, ‘vtxX’, ‘vtxY’, ‘vtxZ’], ‘HLF’: [‘HT’, ‘MET’, ‘MT’, ‘PhiMET’, ‘bJets’, ‘nJets’]}, rows_per_event={‘Particles’: 801, ‘HLF’: 1})[source]¶

Helper Function - Gets a numpy array from a pandas .h5 file

Parameters:
  • f (str) – The filepath of the pandas file
  • file_start_read (uint) – what samples to start reading with
  • samples_to_read (uint) – the number of samples to read
  • file_total_events (uint) – the total events in the file (if you know it)
  • observ_types (dict) – A dictionary of the features (ordered) to get from pandas for each data type
  • rows_per_event (dict) – A dictionary of the number of rows per event for each data type
Returns:

the numpy array
